title: Hotels and Tour Operators are Eliminating Plastic Straws
body: "Plastic straws are one of the worst offenders in terms of plastic pollution. By putting in alternatives and eliminating their use across &Beyond's lodges, we are doing our part to keep...
readable_content: National Geographic (2023-12-08): Plastic straws are increasingly being banned by hotels, resorts, safaris, and cruises due to their detrimental impact on the environment. The lightweight nature of plastic straws makes them easily find their way into oceans, where they do not biodegrade and instead fragment into microplastics. This causes harm to marine animals that mistake them for food. The article also notes an increase in initiatives to ban plastic straws within the United States and across the globe. Additionally, it highlights the efforts of various hospitality brands to eliminate plastic straw use and mentions alternative straw options such as paper, compostable PLA straws, and even uncooked pasta and rye stems.
summary: The text highlights the increasing bans on plastic straws due to their negative impact on the environment, especially in marine ecosystems. It also mentions the efforts of hospitality brands to eliminate plastic straw use and promote alternative options. Overall, the sentiment is supportive of banning plastic straws and promoting environmentally friendly alternatives. Sentiment: 0.9
